description:
If the body of jsp:fallback is supplied via a jsp:body action, the jsp:body
action is treated as template text and appears in the response.

Example output:
------------------------------------------
<OBJECT classid=clsid:8AD9C840-044E-11D1-B3E9-00805F499D93 name="test"
width="10" height="10" hspace="1" vspace="1" align="middle"
codebase="http://www.nowaythiswebsitecouldpossiblyexist.com">
     [java] <PARAM name="java_code" value="foo.class">
     [java] <PARAM name="java_codebase" value="/">
     [java] <PARAM name="java_archive" value="test.jar">
     [java] <PARAM name="type" value="application/x-java-bean;version=1.3.1">
     [java] <PARAM name="test" value="testvalue">
     [java] <COMMENT>
     [java] <EMBED type="application/x-java-bean;version=1.3.1" name="test"
width="10" height="10" hspace="1" vspace="1" align="middle"
pluginspage="http://www.nowaythiswebsitecouldpossiblyexist.com"
java_code="foo.class" java_codebase="/" java_archive="test.jar" test="testvalue">
     [java] <NOEMBED>
     [java] </COMMENT>
     [java]                 <jsp:body>fallback_text</jsp:body>
     [java] </NOEMBED></EMBED>
     [java] </OBJECT>
summary: The jsp:body action doesn't work as expected when used with the jsp:fallback action.
